page.title: 04Oldmeldrum Traders
page.content: Oldmeldrum is a burgh of Barony, still hereditary property of the Laird of Meldrum who lives on the historic estate of Meldrum House north of the burgh. Although he has the right to hold a weekly market, there has been none since the World War of 1939-45. Meldrum House is run as an hotel specializing in gourmet food, often prepared by the laird himself. Farmers from the surrounding agricultural area do their weekly shopping in the hypermarkets and department stores of Aberdeen, 20 miles to the south. Local shopkeepers still do a regular trade in spite of the competition and there are three carpentery businesses, two plumbing contractors, a slater and two electricians fully employed on local work. Two butchers' shops thrive in a meat-eating area famed for its prime cuts of Aberdeen-Angus beef.
